page.title: 14WIX BY-PASS,BY IAN WOOD
page.content: UP TO 1972 ALL THE TRAFFIC ON THE MAIN A604 ROAD FROM HARWICH TO COLCHESTER PASSED THROUGH THE NARROW VILLAGE STREET OF WIX. HOUSES WERE BEING DAMAGED BY VIBRATIONS,CHILDREN WERE AFRAID TO CYCLE AND OLDER PEDESTRIANS WERE VERY NERVOUS OF WALKING BECAUSE OF THE HEAVY TRAFFIC.A NEW BY_PASS WAS OPENED IN 1973.SINCE THEN THE VOLUME OF TRAFFIC HAS INCREASED EVEN MORE.THE BUSIEST TIMES ARE IN SUMMER WITH TOURISTS USING THE FERRIES TO HOLLAND,DENMARK,GERMANY AND SWEDEN.THE BUSIEST TIMES OF DAY ARE JUST BEFORE THE FERRIES DEPART AND JUST BEFORE THEY ARRIVE.WE CARRIED OUT A SURVEY OF TRAFFIC PASSING BY DURING ONE HOUR,FROM1-30pm TO 2-30pm ON THURSDAY MAY 16TH 1985.THESE WERE OUR RESULTS: LORRIES:96 CARS:230 VANS:50 MOTOR CYCLES :7 COACHES :1
